DOC.brief_summary: This study aim evaluate efficacy safety 1,414nm Nd : YAG laser system ( ACCUPLASTI ) add Percutaneous Epidural Neuroplasty ( PEN ) , conventional treatment , alleviate back pain lumbar herniated intervertebral disc patient .
DOC.brief_title: The Efficacy Safety 1,414 nm Nd : YAG Laser System Alleviating Back Pain Lumbar Disc Patient
DOC.criteria: Adult patient 1979 year old Patients moderate disability base Oswestry Disability Index ( ODI ) , among diagnosed single level unilateral herniated intervertebral disc among 3rd4th 4th5th lumbar vertebra , 5th lumbar vertebrasacral vertebra back pain radiating pain low extremity unresponsive conservative therapy six week Patients language skill enough answer questionnaire Patients agree voluntarily participate study sign Informed Consent Form , able participate entire period study Patients multilevel , farlateral , bilateral lumbar herniated intervertebral disc Patients use electronic medical device cardiovascular system Patients spondylolisthesis relevant lesion Patients neurological defect Patients undergone surgery relevant lumbar vertebra Patients cauda equina syndrome Patients congenital spinal deformity Patients spinal fracture Patients spinal infection , tumor , form inflammatory spondylopathy Patients coagulation disorder Patients history malignant tumor ( except cure tumor occurrence last five year ) Patients participate another clinical study within 30 day screen visit Female patient childbearing potential agree use medically acceptable contraceptive method* 24 week use investigational medical device study Medically acceptable contraceptive method : Condom , oral contraceptive pill take continuously three month , contraceptive injection implant , intra uterine contraceptive device , etc . Patients pregnant breastfeed Other patient consider unfit participate study clinically significant finding base investigator 's judgment
